body:
@yassineAlouini That makes sense and the change seems small and low-risk. I suggest you go ahead and submit a pull request. The dev team might just merge it.

Linking the relevant doc from anaconda.com: https://www.anaconda.com/how-to-get-ready-for-the-release-of-conda-4-4
Perfect. I will work on this on the weekend and submit a PR. More to come soon. :)

As far as I can tell, these are the 2 places to fix:

1. [Projects](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/8e820dab991ff790957c3a2a5c679ac35bf9b7a4/mlflow/projects/__init__.py#L617)
2. [Pyfunc](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/8e820dab991ff790957c3a2a5c679ac35bf9b7a4/mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py#L100)

@yassineAlouini Did you manage to push the changes?
If not I will look through and submit a PR tonight

@eric-vader I lacked time to do it these last months and I was on vacation these last weeks. I don't know if you managed to finish the PR and if it isn't done yet, I am more than happy to help you review it. Again, sorry for the late answer.
Sure no worries! I can submit the PR this week! @yassineAlouini
Hi, any updates on this? 'mlflow run' is failing for me because of 'source activate'. Can someone please go ahead and merge it into the master.

@yassineAlouini @rajatpundir I have just submitted the pull request for the modification to projects only. 

I am not so sure if I should make the changes repo wide in pyfunc and also in the docker backend, as I do not use them at all! From what I tell they are containerized, so changing to `conda activate` would just improve the speed and have no other effects.

1. `mlflow/pyfunc/backend.py`
2. `mlflow/sagemaker/container/__init__.py`

If someone can advise, that will be great!

@eric-vader I don't use the docker backends as well but since 'source activate' is deprecated, I don't think replacing it with 'conda activate' would create any problem. You could leave out the changes for containers for now if you are not sure and make the other changes that you are sure about and someone else will pickup the work in future for the containers.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This issue has not been interacted with for 60 days since it was marked as stale! As such, the issue is now closed. If you have this issue or more information, please re-open the issue!
